g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute

in his novel The Mysterious Island. Autonomous vehicles have regularly occupi
Such narratives, scenario building, and foresighting are
increasingly seen as a part of the climate change mitigation process
the important role of positive images about the future instead of dystopian visions and the impossibility
Transport visions can be a part
of this cultural change as well as the more frequently presented visions
There are some emerging technologies like
Maglev, Hyperloop, and Drones that are likely to continue t
and which are only recently at the imagination stage. Decarbonised visions for heavy
vehicle systems appear to be a core need from the assessment of technologies in this
visioning or foresighting requires deliberative processes and the liter
ature contains a growing list of
transport success stories based on such processes
reducing GHG emissions from the transport sector would benefit from creative visions that integrate a
bout technologies, urban and infrastructure planning (including transport, electricity,
and telecommunication infrastructure), and human behaviour and at the same time can create
s, local pledges and net zero strategies:
and local governments are now producing transport plans with a climate emergency focus
. Such plans are often grounded in the goals of the Paris Agreement, based
around Local Low Carbon Transport Roadmaps that contain targets for
pledges from local stakeholders, such as work
places, local community groups, and civil society
fuel based cars, buses, and trucks
, strategies to meet the targets through infrastructure, urban regeneration and incentives, and
detailed programs to help citizens adopt change.
passes, parking charges, or eliminating car benefits. Community
based solutions like solar sharing, community charging, and mobility as a service can generate new

transport roadmaps, which are also supported by the UNCRD’s Environmentally Sustainable Transport
(Baeumler et al. 2012; Pathak and Shukla 2016; UNCRD 2020)

ed at a personal level and applied through every level of activity from
individual, household, neighbourhood, business, city, nation or groups of nations
and are increasingly being demonstrated through shared communities and local activism
(Bloomberg and Pope 2017; Sharp 2018; Figueres and Rivett
financing institutions are also engaging in decarbonisation efforts by requiring their recipients to
commit to Net Zero Strategies before they can receive their funding (C
. As a result, transparent methods are emerging for calculating what
these financing requirements mean for transport by companies, cities, regions, and infrastructure
projects (see Chapters 8, 15). The continued engagement of financial institutions may, like in other
sectors, become a major factor in enabling transformative
futures for transport as long as governance
and communities continue to express the need for such change.
Tools and Strategies to Enable Decarbonisation of the Transport Sector
Using the right tools and strategies is crucial for the successful deployme
summarises the tools and strategies to enable electromobility, new fuels for aviation and shipping,
and the more social aspects of demand efficiency.
